attributes.title: Market Research Manager - Mobile Phones
attributes.description:
IDC is looking for a Research Manager for its Mobile Phones Program, to be based out of Cairo, Egypt. The successful candidate will serve and manage the regional operations as well as support goals and business strategy in Middle East and North Africa regions

Responsibilities of this Position:

  • Effectively engage with C-level and senior executives at Telcos, e-commerce and other distributors in the channel.
  • Assume ownership of data and provide reviews for Saudi Arabia and other Middle Eastern markets.
  • Independently provide effective responses and solutions to client enquiries and ensure client satisfaction. The role will be assigned to key clients direct from Day 1.
  • Remote management of contacts: Build and maintain a network of vendors, channel partners and other technology industry players in the country and the region including traders and re-exporters. 
  • Contribute to business development by leveraging existing C-level and senior-level industry relationships.
  • Conduct primary and secondary research focused in Middle East and Africa for IT devices and technologies including but not limited to: Mobile Phones
  • Contribute to custom research engagements, including with other teams within IDC. 
  • Public speaking and periodic public presentations at IDC events and clients 
  • Ability to work well under pressure and strictly adhere to deadlines
  • Regularly work with quantitative market sizing and forecast tools
  • Regularly write insightful reports (including publications and press releases) with ability to draw meaningful conclusions from data.

Travel Requirements: The research manager will be required to travel at least quarterly to cover Middle East countries effectively (including Saudi Arabia).
attributes.requirements:
• Minimum 8-10 years’ experience in similar industry position or relevant work experience in research in the Middle East;
  • Must have knowledge of the mobile phone and/or devices industry experience in telecom operators, mobile phone vendors, channel partners (retailers, distributors, online marketplaces);
  • Already established network of contacts within the mobile phone and/or devices industry for Saudi Arabia and other Middle Eastern markets;
  • Excellent written and spoken English;
  • Excellent writing and presentation skills;
  • Ability to manage and work with remote teams in matrix organizations;
  • Must be a self-starter, with the ability to work independently in a results-oriented environment;
  • High proficiency with Excel and other Microsoft Office software packages such as capability to write macros in Excel;
  • Experience with Power BI, Tableau, Python, R is a plus.

attributes.title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
attributes.description:
CEPRES is a leading digital solution provider developing solutions for private equity, the fastest growing institutional asset class today. We develop and distribute an award winning Digital Investment Platform while connecting thousands of professionals to the largest private investment network worldwide. CEPRES is headquartered in Munich, with staff in New York, Denver, Chicago, London, Heidelberg, and Singapore. Our team is incredibly diverse with over 20 nationalities in 6 different locations globally.

At CEPRES we value smart and innovative people who also work effectively in a team environment. As a dynamic, agile company, we encourage our staff to focus on achieving results and growing their potential.

For our BI team we are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst who is passionate about the private equity market and its various businesses, enjoys solving problems quickly, and has a very good technical understanding.

Your tasks & key responsibilities:

  • Interacting with end users to understand their requirements, analyzing them and developing appropriate dashboards in tableau.
  • Extract and analyze data from various databases, drawing actionable insights to enable decision-making on the key questions facing all areas of operations
  • Using SQL to retrieve data from databases and perform transformations on data obtained from multiple data sources in order to make them usable for analysis.
  • Support the launch of new projects, ensuring follow-up and delivery on time
  • Performing statistical analysis either in R or Python.
  • Documenting all the defined process/project related activities appropriately and using Project management tool to capture all activities.
  • Develop and produce presentations, descriptive documentations regarding our products and analysis

Why CEPRES:

  • Being part of a strong and unique growth story – the largest digital Private Markets network based on innovative data gathering and state-of-the art analytical tools
  • Exciting and challenging role in a dynamic and international team & environment
  • Work in private equity - one of the most demanded and attractive finance industries today
  • Professional development opportunities and potential for career growth
  • Support with training and coaching
  • Access to our private gym membership
attributes.requirements:
• University degree in Mathematics, Sciences, business mathematics or equivalent qualification with an analytical focus
  • 5 years+ of business intelligence experience ideally in fast growing environment; private equity experience is a plus
  • Previous experience working in a research or data analyst role
  • Experience in programming with Python or R and SQL. It’s a plus if you have experiences working directly with the internal warehouse (BigQuerry, Redshift, etc)
  • You have hands-on experience working with Excel and Google Sheets at an advanced level (Pivot tables, Index-matches, advanced formulas)
  • You have previously worked with visualization tools (ideally Tableau)
  • Large enthusiasm and strength for analytical challenges as well as well as the ability to recognize complex relationships and adapt them according to management needs
  • Strategic thinker who combines business strategy with technical skills and experience working with fitting business intelligence technologies
  • Excellent written / verbal communication skills in English

attributes.title: Business Analyst
attributes.description:
Objective:

  • Responsible for reviewing the scope of user requested business requirements to implement solutions that will support business objectives.
  • Work directly with the business in partnership with development teams. This position is responsible for interpreting requirements into technical specification documents, supporting data / reporting architects who define and detail a business solution, and supporting application developers who code and test the applications.
  • This position is also responsible for Managing small to medium sized initiatives to ensure that the project meets the Time, Scope, Budget, Benefit and Quality.
  • This is a top-level business analyst and is assigned some of the most complex systems and projects.
  • Responsible for managing the implementation of assigned system projects.
  • Applies specific knowledge of the business and knowledge of systems technology capabilities to business problem solving.
  • Participates in the design, installation and maintenance of complex system projects.
  • Ability to intuitively assess the impact of issues and escalate issues as and when necessary.

Job Description:

  • Manage scope and requirements throughout the project lifecycle.
  • Conduct JAD Sessions with Subject Matter Experts to identify all system requirements.
  • Complete System Design documents based on the information gathered at the JAD Sessions with the business and developers.
  • Conducting walkthroughs of all completed design documents with the team to make sure the documentation is complete and development estimates are accurate.
  • Serving as the main liaison between business users and development staff to ensure that all requirements are met on schedule; communicating business requirement changes to the business users.
  • Completing and distributing documentation in a timely manner so that everyone is kept up-to-date on status and any issues that need to be resolved.
  • Clearly communicate business and technical issues and expectations to business, and IT.
  • Maintain Plan, Issues Log, schedule weekly technical meetings with development team etc when managing small / medium projects independently.
attributes.requirements:
• 5+ years of System Analysis / writing system requirements. 2+ years experience in Data Warehouse and ERP projects is preferable.
  • Excellent teamwork, communication, organization and interpersonal skills; detail oriented.
  • Ability to handle multiple planned and unplanned project tasks, roles and responsibilities.
  • Skilled and proficient in requirements definition, process integration, and solutions delivery.
  • Skilled and proficient in all aspects of Requirements Management and Testing.
  • Strong knowledge of Systems Development Lifecycles (SDLC), change management and business processes.
  • Knowledge of information technologies including a high-end (general) technical knowledge of hardware, software, databases and database technology.
  • Proven ability to handle multiple assignments, tight timelines and manage through project obstacles to consistently deliver results.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.

attributes.title: Data Analyst

attributes.description:

  •  Leads the assessment of client needs utilizing a structured requirements process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing changes) to prioritize immediate business needs and recommends options, risks, and cost vs. benefits.

attributes.requirements:

  • 7+ years of working experience as a Business Systems Analyst
  • Functional Knowledge on a variety of technologies and applications
  • The ability to work with product, business, and application teams to write technical user stories.
  • Listening skills, to understand what people say and to detect what they might be hesitant to say.
  • Analytical skills, to critically evaluate the information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a more general understanding, distinguish presented user requests from the underlying true needs, and distinguish solution ideas from requirements.
  • Systems thinking skills, to be able to see the interactions and relationships between the people, processes, and technology involved in an environment.
  • Observational skills, to validate data obtained via other techniques and expose new areas for elicitation.
  • Modeling skills, to represent requirements information in graphical forms that augment textual representations in natural language, including using modeling languages already established in the development organization.
  • Communication skills, to communicate information effectively and inappropriate forms to customers, marketing, managers, and technical staff.
  • IIBA Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) Certificate is A MUST.

attributes.title: Research Analyst / Sukuk
attributes.description:
Sukuk are fixed income instrument like conventional bonds. However, its implemented in shariah compliant transaction through Islamic contract. Although its implemented through shariah contract, the there are many violations in the shariah transactions that may lead to turning the Islamic bond into a conventional one.

Our rule in sukuk desk is to read and understand the shariah contracts and track the violations (If any) through answering set of Questions.

  • Conducts extensive sukuk research
  • Assists superiors in support cases
  • Exhibits sufficient shariah knowledge in order to complete assignments under guidance of superiors
  • Stays updated on technical matters and applies acquired knowledge appropriately
  • Supporting index team in certain tasks including (daily prices upload, Factsheet data document, expected inclusion and exclusion and testing indices at recalculation)
  • Responsible for daily database update including but not limited to (Announced, Matured, Rating update, updating outstanding amount....etc)
  • Communicating with external parties to acquire any missing information. Ex Banks, shariah boards.

attributes.title: System Analyst
attributes.description:
We are looking for an experienced Business/Systems Analyst with exceptional analytical and interpersonal skills. 

The ideal candidate would be someone who works proactively to determine the requirements of a project or program and would be competent in serving as the bridge between end-users and the engineers who develop the product, creating User Stories, eliciting requirements, writing narratives, and assisting with release planning.

Responsibilities:

  • Gathering, reviewing, and analyzing business/system requirements
  • Creating a detailed business analysis that outline problems, opportunities, and solutions
  • Evaluating, analyzing, and maintaining systems requirements
  • Deploying, maintaining, and troubleshooting core business applications, including application servers, associated hardware, endpoints, and databases
  • Managing the set-up and configuration of systems
  • Writing User Stories, Acceptance Criteria, and BRDs
  • Performing detailed functional and non-functional solution requirements specifications
  • Meeting and coordinating with internal and external stakeholders to establish project scope, system goals, and requirements
  • Collaborating with the UX team to ensure that UX designs align completely with the documented business requirements
  • Supporting developers and QC engineers by clarifying requirements or business concerns raised anytime within the development lifecycle
  • Supporting the Product Manager in product positioning, release planning, and vision/roadmap creation/update
  • Demonstrating the solution scope, business value, solution design, requirements, and identified risks to concerned stakeholders
  • Developing, analyzing, prioritizing, and organizing requirement specifications, data mapping, diagrams, and flowcharts for developers and testers to follow
  • Defining and coordinating the execution of testing procedures, and developing test cases to serve the overall quality assurance process
  • Translating highly technical specifications into clear non-technical requirements
  • Providing the documentation of all processes and training as needed
  • Implementing the best practices needed for well-established and developed scalability, supportability, ease of maintenance, and system performance
attributes.requirements:
• Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a relevant field
  • 2–4 years of experience working with information technologies and systems analysis
  • Strong computer, hardware, software, and analytical skills
  • Proven ability to assess business needs and translate them into relevant solutions
  • Strong understanding and knowledge of the principles and practices associated with database maintenance and administration
  • Experience installing, configuring, documenting, testing, training, and implementing new applications and systems
  • Working knowledge of a wide variety of programming languages
  • Highly proficient technical writing capabilities
  • Advanced knowledge of and experience in Microsoft office tools
  • English language proficiency (verbal and written)

attributes.description:
• To ensure implementing the fraud strategies to manage fraud monitoring in the Issuing and acquiring businesses. Making sure that the fraud losses are kept at the levels defined by the business and card Schemes. 
  • Responsible to detect, prevent, investigate and recover fraud losses. Ensure following the approved operating fraud policy and procedures for the Unit. The fraud manager is responsible to manage the operations of the fraud monitoring, define standards and practices for fraud control and management to minimize exposure to fraud losses, ensuring that the BAU task is performed accurately. The manager is responsible for developing, implementing and modifying coaching programs to ensure the effectiveness of programs delivered to team members while ensuring organization policies and procedures are adhered to.

  • Ensure that the fraud policy is conducted while running the BAU task and support the fraud head identifying key areas of improvement, realize fraudulent occurrence in the business, and Shape strong internal control.

Caduceus Lane MENA is recruiting an experienced Operations Business Analyst who will be responsible for structuring and deployment of analytics-driven operations and streamlining business intelligence to the company operations and alignment to the company’s strategic business growth, operational expansion and geographical markets’ development. Identify, distinguish, and analyze operational management components in the assurance of operational resources optimization and ecosystem procedures value maximization, capitalizing on high-level analytical and quantitative skills.

Common responsibilities include strategic operations analysis, identifying performance trends, scanning business trends, reviewing operational effectiveness parameters, operational-financial analyses with value-driven business interpretation and trends projections. 

Successful candidates shall have strong leadership skills and influence techniques to down cascade the business engagement of all stakeholders and stimulate a structured shared purpose of business.


Duties and Responsibilities: 

  • Capacity and capability to structure, deploy and sustain an Analytics-Driven Operations Management.
  • Establishment of the business intelligence across the organization using direct and indirect professional influence techniques with all relevant stakeholders
  • Mastery of operations equation variables with the value to systematic planning for operations mindset shift for analytics-driven decision making.

  • Design, validate, and clearly document efficient to-be business processes that align with our target operating model, behaviors, and values.
  • Plan, design and manage departmental operating procedures and cross-department business processes serving operations strategic direction and continuous improvement plan

Job Summary:

A financial data analyst prepares financial reports that serve as summary information to managers. The financial data analyst is responsible for identifying relevant insights and compiling analytical reports that enable other employees in the company to make sound decisions. Forward-thinking forecasts based upon research conducted on financial trends are typically a key component of the reports that a financial data analyst prepares.

  • A financial data analyst's role may be more specific to handling accounting information, business process information, internal company statistics, and financial reports, or information on outside companies.
  • The nature of the role depends on the needs of the hiring company and determines if the data collection processes are from divisions within the company or outside the company, and the method of data retrieval that is required and preferred.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Collecting information from other divisions of the company
  • He/She may be responsible for improving current methods used in the collection of data from other parts of the company that retains the integrity and security of the information collected.
  • The reports a financial data analyst prepares may also delve into the realm of non-financial reporting, depending on the needs of the hiring company.
  • Overall, the data analyst's role is to encourage the transfer of relevant knowledge to the parties that require it the most.
  • The position may entail ensuring that information provided by the company to client databases is up-to-date and accurate to prevent conflicts with clients.

attributes.title: Agricultural Researcher
attributes.description:
Initially this job is focused on completing an agroecological data set, focusing on the botanical characteristics of certain plants. The ideal candidate will have research experience and is an independent problem solver. After the completion of the data set, the job will revolve around analyzing this data, and dependent on the research interests or strengths, further research will be done in a certain area, building upon this foundational data set. Future research could be in any of the following fields of agriculture: Horticulture, Plant Physiology, Plant Pathology, Ecology of Disease and Pests, and Soil Fertility.

Success in this endeavor is dependent on independence and flexibility, and the work structure is dependent on that. 

  • Plant List:
  • Find pictures and present them in an appropriate manner.
  • Find growing conditions.
  • Water requirements (dry-mesic etc.) and put that into liters with known water holding capacity of the soil (may need to calculate that themselves)
  • Shade tolerance
  • Heat tolerance
  • Ideal planting time (relative to soil and atmospheric temperatures)
  • Soil pH and nutrient requirements, both macro and micronutrients
  • Canopy/spread (space requirement+ shade creation in understory).
  • Propagation method- cutting, grafting, seeds.
  • Time to fruiting/productive years.
  • Length of productive years
  • Method of regeneration and maintenance
  • Ideal pruning method for tree/shrub in our climate
  • Pests and diseases
  • Biological remedies (bacterial or fungi species)
  • Cultural practices for avoidance
  • Natural predators
  • Living conditions for parasitoid/predatory insect etc.
  • Life cycle of pest/disease
  • Sourcing and procurement of plant material (seeds/grafts etc.)
attributes.requirements:
We at RITEC are always seeking to diversify our research and services, and thus we are starting our agricultural research department. Our Head Agricultural Researcher has completed their post-graduate studies in the #1 Agricultural University in the USA, and is aiming to apply and improve on the wealth of knowledge and experience gained. 

We are looking for a young person with a deep passion for agriculture, and is always seeking more knowledge, and is ready for a never-ending cycle of research, analysis, and application of our findings. We seek to apply and develop cutting edge technology and techniques for sustainable and regenerative agriculture and demonstrate its scalability through the practical applications of our research.

Job Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Agriculture or Science
  • Fresh graduate
  • Willingness to learn and work hard.
  • Excellent English proficiency

Location: GizaThe cash services Analyst works in a high pressure environment working with financial centres (mostly banks) to optimise their cash utilization and costs of cash in transit.  The Cash Services Analyst is mainly focussed on optimizing the cash requirement forecast and plan delivery schedules with the Cash in Tranist partner to meet the best possible optimization of utilization of cash and availability of cash to the end customer. The role also encounters the management of the Cash in Transit companies,  ensuring schedules have been followed as agreed and tasks are performed as planned.

Education and Experience Requirements

Education

  • Bachelor of Science or commerce 
  • Fresh to  2 years experience

Key Areas of Respnsibility

Offer input and gain knowledge as a service manager on products, systems, and services

  • Knowledgeable across the related LOB product range including all solution(s) currently released and supported, but may require assistance to progress an incident with assigned product solution(s)
  1. Knowledgeable on assigned product solution(s) and can investigate issues and very infrequently require assistance 
  2. Very knowledgeable on service delivery procedures and can assist others to met the desired SLAs
  3. Mentoring and assisting support peers in product and systems technical details, management of issues and all aspects of the respective role
  4. Suggest improvements and take preventive measures to consistently improve quality of cash services 
  5. Generate periodical CIT Run report
  6. Research, resolve, and respond to questions received via telephone calls, letters, and callbacks in a timely manner, in accordance with current standards
  7. The service cash disposition plans and controls the amount of cash the ATMs and all activities in which he instructed the Cash Replenishment.
  8. Optimization of cash inventory in ATMs
  9. commissioning, management and control of Cash Replenishment
  10. indicate pitch breaches of the CIT 
  11. Commissioning of replenishment and emptying by implementation, installation and removal of ATM 
  12. sends order for the removal of any cards
  13. inventory of cassettes and keys each ATM
  14. The ATM monitoring services provide applications, which authorized users can employ in order to view and monitor the operating conditions of all ATMs from a central location. The monitoring services visualize operating states based on dialog prompts in which the user can choose the depth layer. This visualisation is furthermore accomplished, by using wallboards, dashboards, and other visual displays (failure indication systems etc.).

 

Design corrective action(s) to resolve product or system problems with no known solutions.

attributes.title: Experience Lead
attributes.description:
The Role!

We are looking for data-driven enthusiasts with a bias to action to develop our customer experience circle. You will support the department’s objectives to help develop bosta structure for scale and execute on providing operational excellence. The ideal candidate for this role should have exceptional analytical skills, a marked taste for operational challenges, and the ability to present information clearly.

What will you do?

  • Develop a thorough understanding of the company’s services.
  • Put together dashboards to monitor performance across the region and to flag potential issues before they become problems.
  • Develop and execute analytical tools to measure operational excellence and be expected to concisely explain both what the numbers are saying and what we should be doing, to senior leadership.
  • Develop and share best practices to scale operations of cities.
  • Document finalized initiatives into standardized operating procedures expeditiously.
  • Track our shipping queue and make sure all the SLAs are aligned.
  • Conduct on-site audits for our Hubs to make sure all the safety procedures are aligned.
  • Drive the day-to-day activities to ensure the accuracy, governance, and maintenance of SOPs.
  • Support the communication and training of SOPs to operational teams.
  • Review regulatory, SOP, and other process documents for clarity and consistency.
  • Identify and manage a list of issues from inception to resolution.
  • Lead and work with cross-functional teams for complaint investigation, root cause analysis, identification, and implementation of corrective/preventative actions.
attributes.requirements:
Who are you?

  • University Degree in any discipline.
  • Previous experience in writing SOPs, processes, procedures, user manuals, and/or work instructions.
  • Absolute team player with strong communication and organizational skills - you can interact with people at all levels of the organization.
  • Balance attention to detail with swift execution - we need to do things quickly, and we need to do them well. Balancing those can be challenging, and this should be a strength.
  • Can-do attitude - we are a lean team, and many times responsibilities may fall out of one’s exact job description; we are looking for folks that are willing to roll up their sleeves to get the job done.
  • Explorer - the ability to self-serve, investigate and get the data we require will make you much more effective in this role. A self-starter attitude is a must!

Preferred!

  • Demonstrated work exposure in process improvement work, preferably in a supply chain capacity.
  • Experience using six sigma for reporting.
  • Hands-on experience using Excel or data-management skills - many say they are great in Excel, fewer truly are. The ideal candidates bring some impressive know-how (and the understanding that there is always more to learn)

attributes.title: Big Data Engineer - Jumia Food
attributes.description:
Jumia is the leading e-commerce platform in Africa. It is built around a marketplace, Jumia Logistics, and JumiaPay. The marketplace helps millions of consumers and sellers to connect and transact. Jumia Logistics enables the delivery of millions of packages through our network of local partners.

JumiaPay facilitates the payments of online transactions for Jumia's ecosystem. With over 1 billion people and 500 million internet users in Africa, Jumia believes that e-commerce is making people's lives easier by helping them shop and pay for millions of products at the best prices wherever they live. E-commerce is also creating new opportunities for SMEs to grow, and job opportunities for a new generation to thrive.

With over 5,000 employees in more than 10 countries in Africa, Jumia is led by top talented leaders offering a great mix of local and international talents and is backed by very high-profile shareholders. Jumia is committed to creating a sustainable impact in Africa. Jumia offers unique opportunities in a vibrant and booming environment, creating new jobs, new skills, and empowering a new generation.

attributes.title: Market Research Analyst - Software Domain
attributes.description:
IDC is the premier global provider of market intelligence, advisory services, and events for the information technology, telecommunications and consumer technology markets. IDC helps IT professionals, business executives, and the investment communities make fact-based decisions on technology purchases and business strategy. More than 1000 IDC analysts provide global, regional, and local expertise on technology and industry opportunities and trends in over 110 countries worldwide. For more than 47 years, IDC has provided strategic insights to help our clients achieve their key business objectives. IDC is a subsidiary of IDG, the world's leading technology media, research, and events company.

IDC Egypt is looking for a business professional to join our team in Cairo, Egypt as a Senior Research Analyst to support our software research business and emerging technologies such as Cloud, Big Data Analytics (BDA), Robotic Process Automation (RPA), Artificial Intelligence (AI), IoT, Blockchain, Edge Computing etc.

Responsibilities

The Senior Research Analyst is expected to conduct research and contribute to creating market size, market forecast, research reports, whitepapers, presentations, and infographics. The candidate should be able to use both primary and secondary sources, to meet research schedules established in conjunction with more senior staff. 

  • Conducting primary and secondary research on the software and emerging technologies such as Cloud, Security, AI, BDA and Blockchain.
  • Authoring and publishing reports on IT market trends for Middle East and Africa
  • Engaging in bi-annual update of software and public cloud services data products (tracker, spending guides etc.) for various markets in Middle East and Africa
  • Ensuring timely delivery of research and consulting engagements.

attributes.title: Quality Assurance Analyst
attributes.description:
About Jumia Cairo Tech Center

Want to be part of the biggest tech center in Africa and work in mixed teams with over 16 different nationalities? Join Jumia Cairo Tech Center where tech meets purpose. At Cairo Tech Center you will be managed by and mentored by top tech leaders in both Portugal and Egypt. You will also be working with state of the art technologies & methodologies, and using agile philosophy, all as means to improve the lives of millions of Africans across the continent by offering them convenient and affordable online solutions. And with that as our PURPOSE, innovation at Jumia NEVER stops and you will be moving from one exciting challenge to the next.

About Jumia

Jumia is the leading e-commerce platform in Africa. It is built around a marketplace, Jumia Logistics, and JumiaPay. The marketplace helps millions of consumers and sellers to connect and transact. Jumia Logistics enables the delivery of millions of packages through our network of local partners. JumiaPay facilitates the payments of online transactions for Jumia's ecosystem.

With over 1 billion people and 500 million internet users in Africa, Jumia believes that e-commerce is making people's lives easier by helping them shop and pay for millions of products at the best prices wherever they live. E-commerce is also creating new opportunities for SMEs to grow, and job opportunities for a new generation to thrive.

With over 5,000 employees in more than 10 countries in Africa, Jumia is led by top talented leaders offering a great mix of local and international talents and is backed by very high-profile shareholders. Jumia is committed to creating sustainable impact in Africa. Jumia offers unique opportunities in a vibrant and booming environment, creating new jobs, new skills, and empowering a new generation.

attributes.title: Finance Manager / Director
attributes.description:
Job Information

Company Profile: A well established multinational trading company with Head office located in Dubai.

Job Purpose:

The Finance Manager / Director is responsible for planning, controlling, monitoring, assessing company risks, reporting and ensuring the financial success and health of the Region as well as aligning with company financial strategies. He ensures healthy cash flow management and dividend distribution in line with the Group’s financial objectives. 

Department: Finance & Accounting

Reporting to: Group CFO

Grade: Upper Management

Scope of Responsibilities: Regional (Egypt, Jordon, Iraq)

Key Responsibilities

  • Plan and supervise the overall finance function including: - Cash management

                   - Assets control

                   - Accounts receivable

                   - Inventory

                   - Accounts payable

  • Establish relationship with key customer finance heads
  • Follow up with collectors for both Govt and Private payments. Follow up with sales / service teams to ensure all documents are correctly prepared for submission to Govt customers.
  • Manage and ensure compliance with the regulatory and legal requirements including tax, licensing and permits, audit, labor, social security and trade law etc.
  • Handle external auditors, insuring that financial statements are ready for audit on time.

  • Regularly prepare the data required for the business reviews and report on deviations from the plan and recommend the corrective measures if required.
  • Set performance agreement for accounting personnel and review their performance periodically.

attributes.title: Senior Fraud Analyst - French Speaker
attributes.description:
• A senior fraud analyst specializes in financial transaction monitoring, analyzing suspicious activities that could potentially include fraud. The job responsibilities of a fraud analyst include 24/7 fraud transaction monitoring, action the detected fraud cases, report the fraud cases to the scheme, analyzing the point of compromise, provide feedback on Fraud Rules effectiveness and recommend enhancement to the fraud rules. Immediate notification and fraud reporting to client banks. Fraud analysts are responsible for tracking fraudulent activities, which may involve monitoring financial transactions and analyzing the data retrieved for irregular patterns. 
  • Develops MIS documentation to allow for smooth operations and provide strong reporting and analytical information support to management team 
  • Monitor transactional-based card spends on a 24x7 basis as per company procedures, agreed service standards and in accordance with agreed controls and procedures.
  • Monitor transactional-based card/merchant spends on daily basis as per company procedures, agreed service standards and in accordance with agreed controls and procedures.
  • Notify the client bank of suspicious transactions activities on their card/merchant accounts and take necessary actions as per company procedures in accordance with agreed controls and TAT’s.
  • Contact cardholders and merchants on suspicious activities on their card/merchant accounts and take necessary actions as per company procedures in accordance with agreed controls and TAT’s.
  • Conducting the review of all triggered alerts based on the pre-defined rules in the fraud detection tool.
  • Identify fraudulent trends and execute the appropriate action as per the unit process.
  • The daily set target of alerts evaluation to be achieved per shift, and all queued alerts to be cleared maintaining no pending alerts by Shift and on timely manners.
  • Follow the proper channel of escalation and ensure that all critical issues are reported on time to guarantee the rapid fix.
  • Ensure that the fraud card reports (documents) for all cases are properly produced and documented for future record.
  • Initiate outbound fraud alert notification through email to the internal team, Banks, Merchants, business.

attributes.description:
IDC is looking for a Market Research Manager for its Services Program, to be based out of Cairo, Egypt. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to spearhead IDC's market analysis and advisory services that are delivered to IT services and telecom providers in the Middle East, Turkey and Africa region.

The Telecommunications and IT Services Program develops and delivers market analysis, advisory and consulting to telecommunication providers, multi-national IT services companies and local / regional system integrators and service providers covering technology areas such core telecom and connectivity services such as fixed and mobile voice and data, 5G, SDN/NFV, cloud, Edge Computing, the Internet of Things (IoT), managed services, datacenter services, security services, outsourcing, system integration services, business process outsourcing (BPO), and business consulting services, to name a few.

The Program comprises a team of market analysts who deliver advisory on market opportunity, market entry, portfolio strategy, competitive strategy and other such areas.

  • Support Services teams on trackers, spending guides, standardized consulting project deliverables, syndicated reports etc. wherever required.

  • Support the execution of existing and new initiatives being undertaken by the services team; in particular related to Services Contract database, IDC trackers, and Marketscape documents.

attributes.title: Internal Consultant
attributes.description:
The KPI Institute is a research institute specialised in business performance. It operates research programs in 12 practice domains, ranging from strategy and KPIs to employee performance, and from customer service to innovation performance. Insights are disseminated through a variety of publications, subscriptions services, and through a knowledge platform available to registered members. Support in deploying these insights in practice is offered through training and advisory services.

The KPI Institute is considered today the global authority on Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) research and education. It developed the first KPI Management Framework and operates www.smartkpis.com, the result of the research program dedicated to documenting and cataloguing how KPIs are used in practice, an online portal containing the largest collection of documented KPI examples.

Your main responsibilities include:

RESEARCH

  • Analyses and synthesizes of research outputs generated by Business Research Analysts and Assistants;
  • Transposes research findings into conclusions, presents his/her own point of view/approach in a standardized manner;
  • Gets familiar fast with industries or domains (specific terminology, players on the market and trends, challenges) which were not familiar to him or her priorly.

KNOW-HOW

  • Proposes new ideas for business management which are reflected in new products/services of the organization (solution design to modern business challenges);
  • Conceptualizes strategy and performance related frameworks to be used by client organizations;
  • Develops maturity assessment models in the area of strategy and performance to be used by organization or to conduct evaluations for client organizations;
  • Develops toolkits which ready to use tools by clients and The KPI Institute (TKI) consultants;
  • Writes whitepapers and shares content on social media (LinkedIn).

CONSULTANCY

  • Proposes and designs solutions for modern strategy and performance management challenges of client organizations (online/ offsite consultancy);
  • Develops step-by-step guides and tools for consultancy services that are provided to TKI consultants in project implementations;
  • Engages effectively with various stakeholders (TKI consultants, TKI partners and external research contributors) to identify challenges, needs and improvement areas for TKI services and products in a specific domain (e.g. strategy, performance measurement);
  • Responds to clients' questions and reviews answers formulated by Business Research Analyst.

TRAINING

  • Creates and reviews training course content (course curricula, manual, slides, exercises, tests);
  • Evaluates and improves on a regular basis training courses included in The KPI Institute's portfolio;
  • Reviews customized training courses to a specific industry or functional area;
  • Assesses Practitioner Portfolios as part of The KPI Institute's certification process;
  • Conduct Practitioner Interviews;
  • Delivers webinars and training courses (courses are usually for colleagues).

MANAGEMENT

  • Acts like a project manager for product/services development;
  • Acts like a mentor for Research Business Analysts with potential;
  • No subordinates;
  • Reports to Head of Research Department.
attributes.requirements:
We expect you to:

  • Min. Bachelor's degree
  • Experienced as Business Analyst, Strategic Planning, Management Consultant, Researcher
  • Experienced in training delivery and training content development
  • Have strong knowledge in one or more of: strategy, KPIs, BSC, OKRs, productivity measurement, employee performance, data analysis
  • Have consultancy, analytical, and writing skills
  • Have a learning agility and be a fast learner
  • Open to feedback and knowledge sharing
  • Proficiency in English (written and verbal)

attributes.title: Researcher
attributes.description:
We’re looking for a highly motivated Researcher who wants to join an international start-up and take on the challenge of their life! Our vision is to build the world’s best company, therefore we need to build the world’s best team.

Profile:

Researcher's duties include aligning methodologies with research goals, using a range of tools to acquire information and interpret data, writing up reports and presenting findings and schedules to management and other stakeholders, identifying trends and patterns, conducting fieldwork and Interviews when required, as well as protecting databases and confidential information. You should be able to deliver presentations and communicate effectively at all levels.

To be successful as a researcher, you should be resourceful, and demonstrate excellent time management and patience. Outstanding researchers are passionate about their subject matter and able to meet strict deadlines.

Key responsibilities:

  • Interpreting research specifications and developing a work plan that satisfies requirements.
  • Conducting desk review, and using books, journal articles, newspaper sources, questionnaires, surveys, polls, and interviews to gather data.
  • Analyzing and interpreting patterns and trends.
  • Recording findings by taking written notes and using appropriate software.
  • Maintaining and protecting electronic databases.
  • Assisting management with budget and time schedules.
  • Anticipating research issues and promptly resolving them.
  • Promptly reporting any problems to the relevant stakeholders.
  • Following a strict code of ethics and protecting any confidential information at all times.
  • Writing proposals and delivering presentations when required.

What you can expect from us

  • Learn and work with some of the best entrepreneurs that will give you insights to all relevant aspects of building a company.
  • Work in a flat, modern organisation with no bureaucracy where trust is the most important trait
  • Explore and learn from new cultures that are most likely very different from what you’re used to.
  • Work in a fast-paced company where time between decision to action is minimal.
  • The opportunity to build a b2b marketplace in retail space, a global business, meaningful network and experience

attributes.title: Business Research Analyst
attributes.description:
The KPI Institute is a research institute specialised in business performance. It operates research programs in 12 practice domains, ranging from strategy and KPIs to employee performance, and from customer service to innovation performance. Insights are disseminated through a variety of publications, subscriptions services, and through a knowledge platform available to registered members. Support in deploying these insights in practice is offered through training and advisory services.

The KPI Institute is considered today the global authority on Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) research and education. It developed the first KPI Management Framework and operates www.smartkpis.com, the result of the research program dedicated to documenting and cataloguing how KPIs are used in practice, an online portal containing the largest collection of documented KPI examples.
 Your main responsibilities include:

RESEARCH

  • Research on the topics of Entrepreneurship, Excellence, Finance, Sales, & Marketing (mainly secondary research on internet, occasionally primary research)
  • Centralizes research findings in a structured manner
  • Analysis and synthesis of research outputs generated by himself/herself or by Research Assistants
  • Gets familiar fast with industries or domains (specific terminology, players on the market and trends, challenges) which were not familiar to him or her priorly
     

KNOW-HOW

  • Shares ideas for new products/services in the team
  • Develops comparative analysis of similar frameworks, models and toolkits (highlights common themes as well as particularity
  • Develops and supports the Internal Consultants in developing the frameworks, maturity assessment models and toolkits
  • Handles the formatting of all tools developed (Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Power BI, Word)
  • Writes articles and shares content on social media (LinkedIn)

CONSULTANCY

  • Is involved in offsite consultancy under the supervision of the Internal Consultant
  • Supports offsite consultancy with data collection & processing
  • Responds to clients' questions 

TRAINING

  • Creates training course content (manual, slides, exercises, tests)
  • Assesses course participants' assignments from Professional Certifications
  • Customizes existing training courses to a specific industry or functional area

attributes.title: Algorithm Engineer
attributes.description:
• Design and develop signal processing algorithms for deriving medical parameters from raw sensor data
  • Design and develop data analytics tools for building insights from clinical and internal testing data
  • Translate system requirements to design specifications in collaboration with internal and external design and development teams
  • Searching for suitable algorithm for the assigned problem in reputable papers, patents, and articles that complies with customer/marketing/standards requirements
  • Compare found algorithms and choose the most suitable one according to processing time, complexity, and result inaccuracy
  • The design document includes all the information about the chosen algorithm supported with
  1. Causes of choosing the algorithm,
  2. Algorithms flow chart,
  3. Graphs of the results of the selected algorithm and details about excluding other algorithms,
  4. Algorithm risk analysis document.

  • Communicate technical issues with the research team leader during project/product study in the initial phase.
  • Testing design and execution of the implemented algorithm.
  • Manage and document test results for required certifications.
